newsitem.title: USA: Chrysler, UAW to resume local talks.
newsitem.headline: Chrysler, UAW to resume local talks.

text.p: Bargainers for Chrysler Corp and the United Auto Workers union were scheduled to meet for face-to-face, plant-level talks Tuesday afternoon, sources familiar with the negotiations said.
The move could signal a break in the nearly month-old strike by 1,856 Mound Road Engine plant workers that has crippled light truck production of the U.S. No. 3 automaker.
Up to now, there have been intermittent telephone conversations between senior company and union officials, but no bargaining at the local level.
Chrysler and UAW officials declined to comment.
The strike has forced Chrysler to idle eight assembly plants, affecting a total of 18,916 hourly workers.
